CanStaging - the Cancer Staging Tool cal: CanStaging - the Cancer Staging Tool calculates TNM, Stage, Grade, and other site-specific stage scores from raw information entered by the user.
By Sattar Rahimbeyli and Matanat Ahmadov: By Sattar Rahimbeyli and Matanat Ahmadova.
Welcome to CanStaging, a Cancer Staging: Welcome to CanStaging, a Cancer Staging Tool. The tool will help maximise the availability, standardisation and comparability of cancer staging internationally.
Used with the permission of the Union fo: Used with the permission of the Union for International Cancer Control (UICC), Geneva, Switzerland.
The original source for this material is: The original source for this material is
TNM Classification of Malignant Tumours,: TNM Classification of Malignant Tumours, 7th Edition, published in November 2009 by Wiley-Blackwell.
This tool has been reproduced with due c: This tool has been reproduced with due care
Any inconsistencies with the UICC TNM cl: Any inconsistencies with the UICC TNM classification 7th edition and published errata are unintentional. Neither NICR nor UICC carry any liability should unforeseen errors emerge.
Extension to chest wall (not including o: Extension to chest wall (not including only pectoralis muscle)
Ulceration/ipsilateral satellite nodules: Ulceration/ipsilateral satellite nodules/oedema (incl. peau d"orange) of skin
Micrometastases only: none >2.0mm (but:: Micrometastases only: none >2.0mm (but: >0.2mm or more than 200 cells)
Metastases in internal mammary nodes wit: Metastases in internal mammary nodes with metastases in sentinel lymphnode (not clinically detected)
Metastases in clinically detected intern: Metastases in clinically detected internal mammary nodes
Number of positive axillary nodes (at le: Number of positive axillary nodes (at least one deposit >2.0mm)
Tumor invades mucosa of bladder or rectu: Tumor invades mucosa of bladder or rectum
Tumour invades subserosa or into non-per: Tumour invades subserosa or into non-peritonealized pericolorectal tissues
Tumour directly invades or is adherent t: Tumour directly invades or is adherent to other organs or structures
Tumour deposit in subserosa, mesentery,: Tumour deposit in subserosa, mesentery, nonperitonealized pericolic or perirectal tissues
Metastases confined to one organ or site: Metastases confined to one organ or site (e.g. liver, lung, ovary, non-regional node)
Metastases in more than one organ/site o: Metastases in more than one organ/site or the peritoneum
Tumour does NOT invade main bronchus: Tumour does NOT invade main bronchus
Tumour involves the main bronchus >= 2cm: Tumour involves the main bronchus >= 2cm distal to the carina
Tumour involves the main brochus < 2cm d: Tumour involves the main brochus < 2cm distal to the carina
Tumour involves the carina or trachea: Tumour involves the carina or trachea
Atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis (: Atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis (NOT entire lung)
Tumour invades any of the following: che: Tumour invades any of the following: chest wall or rib; diaphragm; phrenic nerve; mediastinal pleura; parietal pericardium
Separate tumour nodules in same lobe: Separate tumour nodules in same lobe
Atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis o: Atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis of the entire lung
Separate tumour nodule(s) in a different: Separate tumour nodule(s) in a different ipsilateral lobe
Tumour invades any of the following: med: Tumour invades any of the following: mediastinum; heart or great vessels; recurrent laryngeal nerve; vertebral body; oesophagus
Metastases to ipsilateral peribronchial: Metastases to ipsilateral peribronchial AND/OR ipsilateral hilar nodes AND intrapulmonary nodes
Metastases to ipsilateral mediastinal AN: Metastases to ipsilateral mediastinal AND/OR subcarinal nodes
Metastases to contralateral mediastinal,: Metastases to contralateral mediastinal, contralateral hilar, ipsilateral or contralateral scalene, or supraclavicular nodes
Separate tumour nodule(s) in a contralat: Separate tumour nodule(s) in a contralateral lobe tumour with pleural nodes or malignant pleural (or pericardial) effusion
Tumour clinically inapparent (not palpab: Tumour clinically inapparent (not palpable or visible by imaging)
Tumour incidental histological finding: Tumour incidental histological  finding in = 5% resected tissue
Tumour incidental histological finding  >5% resected tissue
Tumour involves one 1/2 of one lobe or l: Tumour involves one 1/2 of one lobe or less
Tumour involves more than half of one l: Tumour involves more than  half of one lobe
